"Oh? Welcome!": "If you told me you were coming, I would've made something for us..."
"How are things in Aelio?"

"Ilma's been heading over there a lot lately.
He's not causing you all any trouble, is he?"
"He spends most of his time researching something."
"Actually, I'm not really sure what he gets up to."
"I guess he's the same no matter where he is, huh..."
"Oh? You don't?"

"Well, he's probably huddled away
researching one thing or another."

"At least he doesn't seem to be
getting up to any trouble."
"That's reassuring to hear."

"If he starts getting into any funny business,
you let me know right away, alright?"
"...Ah, that reminds me."
"Aina visited me a little while ago."
"She did?"
"On some sort of errand?"
"Yeah."
"She wanted me to tell her what kind of combat training we've done over here."
"She wanted to know what kind of combat training we've done over here."
"Aina told me how she's become a training instructor."
"I think it's a good fit for her; she loves helping people."
"So I told her about the fighting styles that our Grandpa taught us."
"You know how my brothers and I all have really different personalities?"
"Yeah, that certainly didn't make it easy for Grandpa to teach us."
"He would always say something like \"Adapting to your individuality is vital\"."
"He would try teaching us one way, and if that failed, he'd move onto another method."
"Eventually, he found fighting styles that suited all of us and patiently lectured us, one by one."
"And, hypothetically speaking..."
"If Grandpa had just told us to do things the way HE did them..."
"Our personalities might've have just become more like his own."

"...And when I told Aina about that, she was like
\"Wow, I've only thought about it from my own perspective...\""
"She didn't stay long after that."
"I kinda wanted to talk to her a bit more..."
"So what about you?"
"I'd love to hear about what you've been up to lately."
